results.title: The Growth of flowers
results.brief_description: A series of time-lapse studies of roses, orchids, viruses, jack-in-pulpits, and daffodils, as their buds grow and swell and the flower opens out from the bud.
results.description: A series of time-lapse studies of roses, orchids, viruses, jack-in-pulpits, and daffodils, as their buds grow and swell and the flower opens out from the bud.

results.title: Growth of Cities
results.brief_description: A study of some of the factors, which determine the location and rate of expansion of cities, showing the general trend towards a centralization in USA. The factors involved in decentralization of cities, into metropolitan areas as applied to various types of cities, and various theories of city and town planning are presented.

results.title: Growth: a study of Johnny and Jimmy. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Warden and Gilbert at Columbia University
results.brief_description: A study of the development of selected activities common to growing infants. Twin boys are selected and the influence of exercise on the development of each motor function at a number of age levels is studied. During the first 22 months Johnny is kept in a crib and then between the 22 to 25 month period was given intensive exercise. The complex interdependence of practice and maturation in development is illustrated. Reel 1: Development of creeping, development of the sitting position, development of erect locomotion, development in the assumption of an erect posture. Reel 2: A lure is suspended beyond the child’s reach in order to appraise his ability to manipulate pedestals so that he can climb up to obtain the object. Reel 3: in some behaviour activities not only attitude but also neuromotor performance are affected by exercise or restriction of funtion. The following are studies: Swimming behaviour and ascending inclines.

results.title: Growing up in New Guinea
results.brief_description: Looks at the lives the three indigenous New Guinea families through the eyes of a child from each family. The families range from stone-age primitive to partially civilised and fully civilised.

results.title: Growing up in a scary world (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeanne H. Block, Thelma Harms and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Filmed in a nursery school group of 4 and 5 year olds in the spring of 1970 during a time of crisis in the adult world. The staff provided a small sandbox with a number of small toys in order to see how young children use spontaneous play in a time of stress. The results lend themselves to discussion on many issues.

results.title: Growing up female
results.brief_description: This film gives graphic illustration of the kind of conditioning that women undergo in society, in an attempt to examine and question the whole framework of the women’s role. Women from various age-groups are presented, all of them revealing in some degree their mental conditioning. Advertising media are viewed as instrumental in this process. The film raises important questions as to the depth of the problem and the possibilities of liberating women in the present social order.

results.title: Growing up at St Giles
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The care and treatment of physically handicapped children at St. Giles home, Launceston. Boarders and day pupils attend the Home, receiving physiotherapy, schooling and the individual attention and group activities they need to overcome difficulties and stand on their own feet. The types of disabilities treated and examples of how former pupils have settled into ordinary employment.

results.title: Mathematics - a foundation course: groups 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Clamp, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Mathematical meaning of the term “group”, basic requirements, by inter-changing spheres in two different arrangements we can arrive at the same group, (klein 4), symmetry throughout history, predicting vibrations of water molecules.
